uk.org.taverna.server.client
Class AbstractPortValue

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<AbstractPortValue>
          uk.org.taverna.server.client.AbstractPortValue
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<AbstractPortValue>, java.util.Collection<AbstractPortValue>, java.util.List<AbstractPortValue>
Direct Known Subclasses:
PortDataValue, PortListValue
public abstract class AbstractPortValue
extends java.util.AbstractList<AbstractPortValue>

This serves as the abstract superclass of the output port data classes:

  • PortDataValue holds a single data value. For output ports of depth zero it holds the entirety of the data in the port. For ports holding lists it holds the data of each list entry.
  • PortListValue holds a list of items that make up the data of an output port. These list items will be further instances of PortList until the depth of the port is reached, when they will be instances of PortData (or PortError) that hold the actual data values.
  • PortErrorValue holds error data if an error was returned from the server for a particular data point.

Author:
Robert Haines

getContentType

public java.lang.String getContentType()
Get the content type (mime type) of the data held in this value.

Returns:
the content type (mime type) of the data held in this value.

getData

public abstract byte[] getData()
Get all the data held in this port value. This method can only be used on subclasses that actually hold data, such as PortDataValue or PortErrorValue.

Returns:
all the data held in this port value.
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if called on an instance of PortListValue.
See Also:
getData(int), getDataStream(), getDataAsString()

getData

public abstract byte[] getData(int index)
Get all the data held at the specified index of this output value. If this value is a PortListValue then the value at the specified index is returned. If this value is a PortDataValue then only index 0 will return any data.

Parameters:
index - the index of the data to return.
Returns:
the data at the specified index.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index specified does not fall within the bounds of the underlying list of data values.
See Also:
getData(), getDataStream(), getDataAsString()

getDataStream

public abstract java.io.InputStream getDataStream()
Get an input stream that can be used to stream the data held by this value from the server. Note: You are responsible for closing the stream once you have finished with it. Not doing so may prevent further use of the underlying network connection.

Returns:
the stream to read the data from.
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if called on an instance of PortListValue.
See Also:
getData(), getData(int), getDataAsString()

writeDataToFile

public abstract void writeDataToFile(java.io.File file)
                              throws java.io.IOException
Get all data held in this port value and save it to the specified file.

Parameters:
file - the file to write the data to.
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if called on an instance of PortListValue.
java.io.IOException - if the specified file cannot be found, opened or written to for any reason.

getDataSize

public abstract long getDataSize()
Get the size, in bytes, of the data held by this value. For lists this is the total of all the data sizes in the list.

Returns:
the total size of the data in this value in bytes.

isError

public abstract boolean isError()
Does this value hold an error? If this value is a list then each member of the list is checked for errors and true is returned if any error is found.

Returns:
true if there is an error in this value, false otherwise.
